instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't Load OS, Runs Hot!
threads.message:
I have a 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that came in with no signs of liquid damage or other physical damage. The computer powers on and passes Apple built in diags. The computer will load up and about 80% through the loading progress bar then the screen goes black and reboots. The heatsink gets incredibly hot when running for only about a minute. I can get the computer to run at a "normal" temperature with the the trackpad disconnected. I have tried connecting a known good trackpad to the board and it still runs hot. I watched Louis' video on the 00138 that was failing to load an OS due to corrosion but all three of the buck controller ICs look to be in good condition. No corrosion, burns, etc.

PPBUS: 12.54V
PPVRTC: 3.332V
PPVCC: 1.804V
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GFX</SIGNAL>: 0.85V

This is the only remotely questionable buck controller IC, there is a small semi-circle mark on one of the ICs. (attached photo)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't Load OS, Runs Hot!
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't Load OS, Runs Hot!
threads.message: It will load into a bootable High Sierra disk and will start installing a fresh OS on a known good SSD, however when it reboots following the install into the OS for the first time the issue of the black screen and rebooting starts again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't Load OS, Runs Hot!
threads.message: If it gets really unusually hot there may be damage to the CPU. Also check Vcore voltage it may be high due to a bad FET in Vcore supply.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't Load OS, Runs Hot!
threads.message: I don't have a schematic for the 00426 I'm just using the 3787 and hoping it is close enough. I am getting 1.804V on the coils for VCORE and PH1/PH2.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Doesn't Load OS, Runs Hot!
threads.message:
Not sure what it should be on these boards but 1.7/1.8V is common on other boards of this age.
You could replace that FET but also replace the controller chip <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>.
Any mistakes here will kill the CPU so be careful!
